column4: I have some experience with Linux, but none working with Linux-to-OSX samba configs. I am trying to get file sharing to work with OSX, can someone help me?
I too was having funky issues with my friend's OS X laptop
McNellis: if both screens are on Ubuntu, you don't need TwinView
have you got your ubuntu to connect to the OSX machine?
yea, we connected via samba shares
I think you have to tell it to share a folder via Samba; I don't think it defaults to that. OS X that is
yeah, I have it set to that. I can access my ubuntu box from OSX, but I can't access OSX from ubuntu
McNellis: I simply plug both monitors into the same card and you the display configuarations to control it from there
I keep getting a permission denied error
so it must be something with the password encryption I assume...
Watr: Does OS X, like Windows, depend on it being on the same workgroup in order to see it?
OSX recognizes and lists my laptop as an available share as long as ubuntu is set up for samba sharing and smbfs is installed
So you can connect to OSX from ubuntu?  What steps did you take to get it working?
It's been a few months now and a lot of it was trial and error; I'm afraid to say I don't remember exactly what did it :/
can you post your smb.conf so I can take a look?
File is pending to be sent you you; waiting on your authorization. Also, I'm pretty sure it was my buddy on the OS X side that had to change things around
